question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The equation
\[(x - \sqrt[3]{13})(x - \sqrt[3]{53})(x - \sqrt[3]{103}) = \frac{1}{3}\]has three distinct solutions $r,$ $s,$ and $t.$  Calculate the value of $r^3 + s^3 + t^3.$
inference:
Using the identity
\[(a - b)(a - c)(a - d) = a^3 - (b + c + d)a^2 +  (bc + bd + cd)a - bcd,\]we can expand the given product to obtain
\begin{align*}
(x - \sqrt[3]{13})(x - \sqrt[3]{53})(x - \sqrt[3]{103}) &= x^3 - ( \sqrt[3]{13} + \sqrt[3]{53} + \sqrt[3]{103})x^2\\
&\qquad\qquad+ (\sqrt[3]{13}\sqrt[3]{53} + \sqrt[3]{13}\sqrt[3]{103} + \sqrt[3]{53}\sqrt[3]{103})x\\
&\qquad\qquad\qquad- \sqrt[3]{13}\sqrt[3]{53}\sqrt[3]{103}\\
&=x^3 - (\sqrt[3]{13} + \sqrt[3]{53} + \sqrt[3]{103})x^2\\
&\qquad\qquad+ (13\sqrt[3]{53} + 13\sqrt[3]{103} + 53\sqrt[3]{103})x\\
&\qquad\qquad\qquad- 13\sqrt[3]{53}\sqrt[3]{103},
\end{align*}
so that
\begin{align*}
\sqrt[3]{13} + \sqrt[3]{53} + \sqrt[3]{103} &= 3,\\
13\sqrt[3]{53} + 13\sqrt[3]{103} + 53\sqrt[3]{103} &= 3,\\
13\sqrt[3]{53}\sqrt[3]{103} &= 1.
\end{align*}
Therefore,
\begin{align*}
(r + s + t)^3 &= 3^3 = 27,\\
(rs + rt + st)^3 &= 1^3 = 1,\\
r^3 + s^3 + t^3 &= (r + s + t)^3 - 3(rs + rt + st)(r + s +t) + 3rs(rt + st + rs)\\
&=27 - 3(r + s + t) + 3(rs + rt + st)\\
&=27 - 9 + 3\\
&=21.
\end{align*}
Final Answer: $\boxed{21}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Let the roots of $(x - \sqrt[3]{13})(x - \sqrt[3]{53})(x - \sqrt[3]{103}) = 0$ be $\alpha,$ $\beta,$ and $\gamma.$  Then by Vieta's formulas,
\begin{align*}
r + s + t &= \alpha + \beta + \gamma, \\
rs + rt + st &= \alpha \beta + \alpha \gamma + \beta \gamma, \\
rst &= \alpha \beta \gamma + \frac{1}{3}.
\end{align*}We have the factorization
\[r^3 + s^3 + t^3 - 3rst = (r + s + t)((r + s + t)^2 - 3(rs + rt + st)).\]Thus, from the equations above,
\[r^3 + s^3 + t^3 - 3rst = \alpha^3 + \beta^3 + \gamma^3 - 3 \alpha \beta \gamma.\]Hence,
\begin{align*}
r^3 + s^3 + t^3 &= \alpha^3 + \beta^3 + \gamma^3 + 3(rst - \alpha \beta \gamma) \\
&= 13 + 53 + 103 + 1 \\
&= \boxed{170}.
\end{align*}

&\qquad\qquad\qquad- \sqrt[3]{13}\sqrt[3]{53}\sqrt[3]{103}\\

\end{align*}
Therefore,
\begin{align*}
(r + s + t)^3 &= 3^3 = 27,\\

r^3 + s^3 + t^3 &= (r + s + t)^3 - 3(rs + rt + st)(r + s +t) + 3rs(rt + st + rs)\\
&=27 - 3(r + s + t) + 3(rs + rt + st)\\
&=27 - 9 + 3\\

\end{align*}
Final Answer: $\boxed{21}$. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth:
Let the roots of $(x - \sqrt[3]{13})(x - \sqrt[3]{53})(x - \sqrt[3]{103}) = 0$ be $\alpha,$ $\beta,$ and $\gamma.$  Then by Vieta's formulas,
\begin{align*}
r + s + t &= \alpha + \beta + \gamma, \\
rs + rt + st &= \alpha \beta + \alpha \gamma + \beta \gamma, \\
rst &= \alpha \beta \gamma + \frac{1}{3}.
\end{align*}We have the factorization
\[r^3 + s^3 + t^3 - 3rst = (r + s + t)((r + s + t)^2 - 3(rs + rt + st)).\]Thus, from the equations above,
\[r^3 + s^3 + t^3 - 3rst = \alpha^3 + \beta^3 + \gamma^3 - 3 \alpha \beta \gamma.\]Hence,
\begin{align*}
r^3 + s^3 + t^3 &= \alpha^3 + \beta^3 + \gamma^3 + 3(rst - \alpha \beta \gamma) \\
&= 13 + 53 + 103 + 1 \\
&= \boxed{170}.
\end{align*}
